intro: Spergularia bourgaei, commonly known as the coastal sandspurry, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and coastal regions. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or saline environments. Spergularia bourgaei is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Its reproductive strategy includes self-fertilization, which helps it survive in isolated habitats.
